abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            sustainable farming in Serbia for a cleaner Danube river.
            Runoff from livestock waste was responsible for the majority
            of Serbia's part in polluting the Danube and the Black
            Sea. Serbia Danube River Enterprise Pollution Reduction
            Project reduced the basin's considerable levels of
            pollution resulting from improper discharge of manure and
            slurry from cattle and pig farms, and animal waste from
            slaughterhouses and rendering plants. Through the project,
            many farmers also developed fertilizer management plans with
            assistance from local advisory teams. Environmentally
            friendly farming practices were taught at seven agricultural schools.
